intro: Lastrea retusa, commonly known as the smooth lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to dry climates. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in drought conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the warmer months.
